body: hello friends，     use “runenergy simulation”component we can see different output value like cooling，temperature and so on ，but i can‘t find which component can see the value of  “chiller（electricity）”.     and i’m confused about how to set the air condition worktime in monday to friday，9:00~12:00 & 14:00~18:00. can anybody help me？     thanks,                                                                                       sherly [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/HWFDuLYjDx7q4ZJLof9UBkZ68ryUPxryFRuRued-hStTVShvFRsopudKdlRoree*mgKhia2Jy4zWO9gLTYMDYgrnNS8q9m-k/question.png)
topic: Which output component can see the value of “chiller（electricity）”?

replies.body:
Sherly,



If you need outputs of electricity and fuel, you should be modeling a real HVAC system with the OpenStudio component (instead of the default ideal air loads with the energy simulation component) as you see in this example:

[http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=chriswmackey&for...](http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=chriswmackey&fork=hydra_2&id=Calculate_Annual_Utility_Bill&slide=0&scale=1&offset=0,0)



If you use a real HVAC the cooling and heating outputs of the Read EP Result component will be electricity and fuel.



-Chris
